resources.string: "Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."

1. Atopic Dermatitis
 - Dry, scaly skin
 - Redness
 - Itching
 - Cracks behind the ears
 - A rash on the cheeks, arms and/or legs
 - Open, crusted or “weepy” sores (usually during flare-ups)
 
 2. Contact Dermatitis
 - Red
 - Hot
 - Itchy
 - May "weep"
 
 3. Dyshidrotic Eczema
 - Small fluid-filled blisters on the fingers, hands, and feet
 - Itching
 - Redness
 - Flaking
 - Scaly, cracked skin
 - Pain
 
 4. Hand Eczema
 - Redness
 - Itching
 - Pain
 - Dryness, to the point of peeling and flaking
 - Cracks
 - Blisters
 
 5. Neurodermatitis/Lichen Simplex Chronicus
 - Leathery, thickened skin
 - Dark patches on the skin
 - Pronounced skin lines in the patches
 
 6. Nummular Eczema
 - Coin-shaped lesions on arms, legs, torso and/or hands
 - Itching and burning
 - Lesions that are oozing liquid or have crusted over
 - Red, scaly and inflamed skin around the lesions
 
 7. Seborrheic Dermatitis
 - Redness
 - Greasy, swollen skin
 - White or yellowish crusty flakes
 - Skin feels itchy or burns
 
 8. Stasis Dermatitis
 - Swelling
 - Redness
 - Scaling
 - Itching or pain
